title: Death Cab for Cutie's 'Thank You for Today' is a Delight
summary: The album opens with the title track, “Thank You For Today” “Happy Birthday” is a sweet love song that features Gibbard’s voice at its most vulnerable. “Stay-cation” has a very colorful and lighthearted song with a lot of energy and movement to it. “Some Things You Can’t Change" has a nice, easygoing sound and a very mellow tempo. It is a very thoughtful and reflective song with lyrics that make you think about your life.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thank You for Today is the sixth album from Seattle indie rockers Death Cab for Cutie. Released on August 31, 2018, it\u2019s also the band\u2019s final record with their original label Atlantic Records. After two decades in the music business, Death Cab for Cutie have developed into one of the most beloved bands in indie rock.
After their last album, Codes and Keys (2012), frontman Ben Gibbard announced that he was working on a solo project called The New Age. It was something he had been thinking about for some time but wasn\u2019t sure when or if it would come to fruition. Fortunately, after meeting with producer Rich Costey (M83, Blond Redhead) who helped him record some demos, things fell into place. The album came out as a collaborative release between Ben Gibbard and Nathan Wiley under the name The Further Adventures of New Age. And three years later Death Cab For Cutie released Thank You For Today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Track Review:"),mdx("p",null,"The album opens with the title track, \u201CThank You For Today\u201D. A sprawling, 6-minute epic, it sets the tone for the rest of the release. The song is a meditation on mortality and pathos, but with a sense of hope. Death is an inevitability, but it\u2019s powerless if you don\u2019t let it control your life. Gibbard\u2019s voice is clear and crisp as ever, while the instrumentation is lush and inviting."),mdx("p",null,"The second track, \u201CHappy Birthday\u201D, is a sweet and delicate acoustic track. It\u2019s a sweet love song that features Gibbard\u2019s voice at its most vulnerable. It\u2019s a great contrast to the dark, moody title track that opened the album."),mdx("h2",null,"Title Track"),mdx("p",null,"The title track of the album has a refreshing, light sound to it. Although it falls into the indie rock genre, it\u2019s not the type of music you would expect from Death Cab for Cutie. The music is upbeat, lighthearted and easy to listen to. It is a great upbeat song with a positive message to it."),mdx("p",null,"It is also the longest track on the album and clocks in at six minutes and twenty-four seconds long. In the song, Gibbard sings about his relationship with his home and the city of Seattle. It\u2019s a song about appreciating the good things in life and finding hope in the future despite what may come. It\u2019s a song about finding beauty in ordinary things and celebrating that."),mdx("h2",null,"I Dreamed We Were Already There"),mdx("p",null,"This track starts out with a very acoustic feel to it. The lyrics and melody make you feel like you are sitting in a coffee shop with a nice cup of coffee on a rainy day. It is a very down-to-earth, calming song. It is a song that would be great to listen to on a rainy day when you are trying to relax and be low-key."),mdx("p",null,"The song has a nice beat to it, but it\u2019s not too loud or in-your-face. It\u2019s like a song you might hear playing in the background of a coffee shop. It is a very chill song that is great to listen to while relaxing and decompressing. The song has a slower tempo and is more low-key than other songs on the album."),mdx("h2",null,"Stay-cation"),mdx("p",null,"This track has a very upbeat tempo and sound to it. It is a very colorful and lighthearted song with a lot of energy and movement to it. The song has a very upbeat tempo and is a nice, catchy tune to listen to. It is a fun, upbeat song that would be great to listen to while you\u2019re out and about doing activities or even cleaning. It\u2019s a great tune to listen to when you\u2019re having a low-key day."),mdx("p",null,"The song is about staying in and relaxing when you don\u2019t have the money to go on vacation. It\u2019s about doing activities and having low-key fun when you don\u2019t have the luxury to go on a high-end trip. It\u2019s a great, fun song with a very upbeat tempo and sound to it."),mdx("h2",null,"Summer years"),mdx("p",null,"This track is another low-key song. It has a very mellow sound to it. It is like a song you would hear playing on a rainy day when you are curled up inside with a nice cup of coffee or tea. It is a very slow piano-driven song. The melody and lyrics make you feel like you are sitting inside and reflecting on your life and looking toward the future."),mdx("p",null,"The song has a nice, relaxing tempo to it. It\u2019s a very chill song that is great to listen to when you are just trying to relax and unwind from a busy day. The song has a very gentle melody to it and a nice, easygoing sound to it."),mdx("h2",null,"Some Things You Can\u2019t Change"),mdx("p",null,"This track has a very mellow sound and tempo to it. It is a very reflective and thoughtful song. It has a nice, easygoing sound and rhythm to it. It is a very thoughtful song with lyrics that make you think about your life. It is a song that you would listen to when you are trying to just relax and reflect on your life."),mdx("p",null,"It is a very thoughtful song with lyrics that make you think about your life and reflect on past experiences. It is a very chill song that is great to relax and unwind to. It has a nice, easygoing sound and rhythm to it."),mdx("h2",null,"Broken Together"),mdx("p",null,"This track has a very upbeat sound to it. It is a very positive sounding song with a lot of energy and movement to it. It is a very cheerful sounding song with a lot of positivity. It is a great upbeat song with a positive and optimistic message to it."),mdx("p",null,"The song is about letting go of the past and moving on with your life. It is a song about finding beauty in even the darkest moments in your life. It is a great upbeat song with a positive and optimistic message to it."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Death Cab for Cutie\u2019s Thank You For Today is a wonderfully nostalgic affair. The album is a beautiful journey through the band\u2019s past, present and future. And while it certainly has its fair share of low-key moments, it\u2019s primarily an upbeat, joyous record. It\u2019s also a fitting sendoff for the band and their long relationship with Atlantic Records. It\u2019s an album full of hope, promise and love."),mdx("p",null,"Indie rock has long been a young man\u2019s game, but Death Cab for Cutie prove that you can grow old with the music you love. These veterans have managed to expand their sound and craft a record that feels incredibly vibrant and alive. Fans will be delighted to discover that Death Cab for Cutie\u2019s sound is as fresh as ever."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Babadook" Is a Haunting and Original Horror Film
9 of the Best Hip Hop Songs for Your Next Workout
"The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`While there has been some great music released this year, the first half of 2018 has not been an exceptional one for new releases. However, that doesn\u2019t mean there hasn\u2019t been some brilliant albums released so far this year. While last year had some incredible albums (like Kendrick Lamar\u2019s \u201CDamn,\u201D Lorde\u2019s \u201CMelodrama,\u201D and Noel Gallagher\u2019s High Flying Birds' "Who Built the Moon?"), this year hasn\u2019t quite matched up to those standards. However, we are only halfway through the year and as such, we have also seen some fantastic new albums released in the last few months that are worth mentioning. There may not be many great new albums out at the moment \u2013 but these five are definitely among the best.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
